intro: Asperugo divaricata, commonly known as the variable thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its branched stems and clusters of small, white or purple flowers. The plant produces berries that range in color from yellow to red, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Asperugo divaricata is known for its spiny leaves and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
